lead_paragraph: HEANEY--Anne M.,87, died at her home in New York City on December 29, 2015. Born in Manhattan on June 18, 1928, Anne lived her entire life in the City. She was employed by Schenley Distillers, and later Samsonite. As a child Anne contracted polio, and that and other health issues bedeviled her for her life. But these did not stop her from living an active life especially intellectually and spiritually. She had a lifelong involvement with religion, especially her Roman Catholic faith. She was active in parish life. Anne also had many friends in the priesthood and had many conversations with them about church issues and doctrine. She was not shy in her opinions. In many ways she was a woman ahead of her time. Anne was devoted to her family. As a second generation immigrant she took many family responsibilities ahead of her own interests. She was instrumental in raising two of her nephews, Robert and John, when their mother, Anne's sister Isabella, needed to work to support the family. She also cared for her widowed mother Janet as she aged. After Janet died Anne moved to the Fort Washington neighborhood where she resided for the rest of her life. To the very end of her life Anne had a vibrant intellect, engaging friends in insightful and stimulating conversations on all current religious, political, medical issue of the day. Anne was predeceased by her parents, Janet and Owen, and her siblings, Edward, Isabella, Owen and Charles. She is survived by her nieces and nephews: Robert, John, Charles, Marie, Janet, and Jude. A Memorial Mass will be held at the Shrine of St. Frances X. Cabrini at 10:30, Tuesday, March 29, 701 Fort Washington Ave. NYC 10040, followed by internment of Anne's ashes at Calvary Cemetery, 49-02 Laurel Hill Blvd, Woodside, NY. 1/3
